page.title: 15West Dean Village Dwellings
page.content: This village has a preservation order on it so that it should be kept as it is without visible alterations.There are about 14 residential properties occupied by professional people.Among these are a property developer,a business machine importer,a dentist, a market gardener,some wine cultivators, artists,retired ex-forestry people,a doctor,educationists and a retired judge.Several homes are conversions from ancient flint barns.A picture of the village before conversion is in the British Museum.The residents do not want or expect any local services.They shop in Eastbourne or Seaford and get medical attention there.Since this hamlet falls within the catchment area of Eastbourne waterworks,no farm animals can be kept.
